clinical_study.brief_title: Severe Complications Triplicate the Costs of Major Surgical Procedures
clinical_study.official_title: Surgical Complications Dramatically Influence Overall Cost of Major Surgical Procedures

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to prospectively assess the impact of surgical quality on the overall cost of major surgical procedures using the incidence and severity of complications as surrogate markers of quality.

detailed_description.textblock: To prospectively assess the impact of surgical quality on the overall cost of major surgical procedures using the incidence and severity of complications as surrogate markers of quality

arm_group.description: Patients collected consecutively for undergoing major surgical procedures(liver, bile duct, pancreas, small bowel, colo-rectal, gastric bypass resections).

intervention.intervention_name: No additional intervention than the intended major surgery in pancreas, liver, colorectal, gastric bypass and small bowel
intervention.description: No additional intervention than the intended major surgery (liver, bile duct, pancreas, colorectal, gastric bypass and small bowel resections) comparing with costs

study_pop.textblock: A cohort study with 1235 patients including consecutive patients undergoing major surgery (liver, bile duct, pancreas, colorectal, gastric bypass and small bowel resections) in a single tertiary care center

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Undergoing major surgery (liver, bile duct, pancreas, colorectal, gastric bypass and small bowel resections)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Missing data of in-hospital costs
- Mortality

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Visceral and Transplantation Surgery

facility.name: University Hospital of Zurich, Department of Visceral and Transplantation Surgery

clinical_study.keyword: The influence and impact of postoperative complications on in-hospital costs
